SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.ontotext.kim.model
Class HashRegister

java.lang.Object
  com.ontotext.kim.model.HashRegister
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class HashRegister
extends Object
implements Serializable

This class implements a hash-code indexed storage for objects. It resembles the HashSet class with these substantial differences:
- The hash-code value is supplied externally - Multiple objects can be stored with equal hash-codes. They are grouped and stored in packages. These packages are implemented as the internal class HashElement.
- Stored objects are retrieved by packages through their hash-code value.
- If stored objects implement Comparable they are sorted in the packages and are returned as a sorted array. This allows binary search within the result.

The implementation of the storage structure as also the resize logic is simplified intentionally. By design it is intended to support only operations addition, search and retrieval (not removal).

Author:
danko
See Also:

Nested Class Summary
static interface HashRegister.ContentProcessor
          This is a listener interface which provides means to perform bulk operations over all of the stored elements in the register.
static class HashRegister.HashElement
          A container class that holds all of the stored objects with same hash-code value.
static class HashRegister.HashElementComp
          Comparator for sorting HashElement instances.

Field Detail

subRegIncrement

protected static int subRegIncrement
Determines the step for extension of the array field HashElement.elementHolder

initialSize

protected static int initialSize
Determines the initial size of the main-register. A better distribution is achieved if it is a prime number.

maxFillPerc

protected int maxFillPerc
Determines the maximal percent of filling of the main-register after which the HashRegister is expanded by doubling its size.

mainReg

protected Object[] mainReg
The main storage structure of the Hash Register. The index under which an object will be stored is calculated through the method mainIx. Calculation is based on the externally provided hash-code of the object and the current size of the array

mainRegLock

protected transient Object mainRegLock
Access synchronization locking object

hashesCount

protected int hashesCount
Number of different hash-code values provided with stored objects

hashesCountLimit

protected int hashesCountLimit
Current limit of the number of distinct hash-code values that could be stored with the current size of mainReg

elementsCount

protected int elementsCount
The number of objects stored in the register

autoResize

protected boolean autoResize
This flag determines if the auto-resizing is turned on

public HashRegister()
This public constructor starts the hash register with predefined size and automatic resizing turned on

HashRegister

protected HashRegister(int newSize,
                       boolean autoRes)
This protected constructor allows starting the hash register with different than default size and automatic resizing option.

Parameters:
newSize - - the initial mainReg size.
autoRes - - the auto-resize flag.
Method Detail

resizeMainReg

public boolean resizeMainReg()
The method resizes the mainReg array if the content volume limit was reached.

Returns:
true if resize was performed

get

public Object get(int hashValue,
                  Object element)
Retrieves an element instance that is relevant to the given hash-code and is equal to the given element.

Parameters:
hashValue - - the hash-code value
element - - the element for comparison
Returns:
the corresponding stored element

exists

public boolean exists(int hashValue)
Checks if there are any stored elements related to the given hash-code value.

Parameters:
hashValue - - the hash-code value
Returns:
true if an HashElement instance is found which has the same as given hash-code value. No check for existence of stored elements is done, so the test is positive even is null element with such hash-code has been added.

exists

public boolean exists(int hashValue,
                      Object element)
Checks if there is a stored element related to the given hash-code value and equal to the given element.

Parameters:
hashValue - - the hash-code value
element - - the element for comparison
Returns:
true if matching element is found.

getElementsCount

public int getElementsCount()
Retrieves the number of stored elements.

Returns:
the elements count

processContent

public void processContent(HashRegister.ContentProcessor cProc)
This method accepts an implementation of the ContentProcessor interface. Then it cycles all of the stored elements in the register and passes them to the process method of the ContentProcessor implementation.

Parameters:
cProc - - ContentProcessor implementation;
